Posts.Content: Hi Janet and everyone, Had my results yesterday and got the ALL CLEAR.  Was overjoyed.  My sister took me as my husband just started working after 13 months unemployment. so we stopped for a tipple and sandwich on way home to celebrate. Just got to have implant builtup now and they start that next month.  Then have the left breast screened every year for next 5 years.    Take care you all    Will pop by another day   Love Celia
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Thank you so much for your lovely kind words.   I hope you ALL get somegood news very soon Lots of love to you all     Celia  x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Kaz Thanks for that    I certainly shall.
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, It's WONDERFUL I've had my mastectomy and am HOME !!!!!!!!!        The op went well and they all are pleased with my progress. So much so that although I was told I would be in until at least Monday, they let me home Sat afternoon.  The surprise and joymwhen I rang my husband I wish I could've seen his face.  He can't seem to do enough for me... Long may it last.  My drain was hardly needed on the Friday night and my arm movements were "fantastic" they said. My appointment for the biopsy is the 14th October, but I feel Very Confident. More than I have before. I am very lop sided as they have not put a full implant in and it'll be 4 to 6 weeks before they start doing that.  So I shall get in touch with the breast care nurse to see about a filler for my bra,    But till then my good old baggy sweaters Thank you ALL for your kind thoughts will be back again soon. Love  Celia  XXX
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, I've got my mastectomy and recon on the 30th.  I totally agree about the waiting. I manage to get to sleep ok but wake up alot during the night. It's like having a lot of Cat-naps.  I would LOVE to lay down at10pm and wake when the alarm goes off at 6. I'm also suffering alot of panic/anxiety attacks.  The goalposts have moved so many times.  What was originally DCIS is now cancer. with extensive DCIS in the right breast, hence the mastectomy. I also have alot of "what ifs" My best bet just before bed is a milky ovaltine. I too have been tidying, but mainly so son/hubby can find things.  My houseis organised chaos, but I KNOW where everything is. Good luck with your op Hugs to ALL cELIA X
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, Sorry to have missed you yesterday, I hope all goes well today. By the time you read this I should hopefully have had my mast. Thursday is right providing a bed is available.  I've to ring at 10 and be there for 11 if 1 is available. Getting a bit nervous, but saying that, had the best nights sleep in a L O N G time. It makes the world of difference. Hope all you other Ladies are doing ok. Love  Celia  x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Jims girl and everyone else for yourkind thoughts. Got to ring hospital in half an hour, so if you don't hear from me for a few days you'll know I've gone in.   Hope NOT to be speaking to you soon. Love  Celia  x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, A big THANK YOU for all your kind words and thoughts.  Each day is a bit better than the previous day. I keep forgetting that I must be careful what I do with my right arm.   Our front door sticks and as I went to open it "OUCH"   But I have got so much movement back it's unbelieveable.   I've managed to cook breakfast AND make some tomato chutney this morning. Sheila, things DO get easier, think positive and don't be afraid to do things.  Your body will tell you when to stop.   As mine is now.  I'm on my sons laptop in his room and it's a bit high, so arm is now aching. Be back another day Love and gentle cyber hugs to everyone Celia  XX
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: I wasgiven the ALL CLEAR from my breast cancer yesterday,Just thought it would be nice to share with you. Take care everyon.  Will still be popping in to have chats Lots of Love Celia   xxx
Posts.Title: ALL CLEAR

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, Sorry to hear about your results.   I go for my results today after identical op 2 weeks ago today.   I have extensive DCIS in right breast but cancer cells had got into tissue, and not lymph nodes. I shall be watching this post with interest too Good luck for next week Celia
Posts.Title: Mastectomy margins

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for that Kate, I've spoken to them, and like you say thery were so kind and helpful. It sems that if my body has rejected one implant it may well reject further implants.   The other alternatives are the "flaps" which I REALLY didn't want to go thru. Which is why I went for immediate implants. The other problem is that I have  eczyma attacking my scars, and I could pull my hair out, along with the breast (which I don't have any more    lol)  I've been prescribed creams, and they clear it up very well. But..... as soon as I stop using it, it comes back.     But hey ho....... I'M STILL HERE !!!!!!!!!!!!   Thanks again Celia    (aka wench)
Posts.Title: Capsular Contracture

Posts.Content: I have been diagnosed with capsular contracture,. I had implants put in at the time of my mastectomy 14 months ago, with inflations taking place over the following 6 months. Not "huge" in that department thank goodness. Since then, I've been very uncomfortable.  I saw my breast consultant last Thursday, and I've been told that I may have to have my implants replaced. Has anyone else been down this road, and offer me any advice Thanks
Posts.Title: Capsular Contracture

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, Been thinking of you.  I too went thru my house like a "dose of salts" so my husband and son didn't have to bother too much with the cleaning.  My son was going to keep on top of the laundry after he finished work (and he was pretty good too for a 23 yr old "boy" (lol)  My sister also made several meals to put in my freezer, as if it was left to husband/son we'd be living on take aways or fry ups!!!!!!! My husband agreed with me, that I should do whatever the consultant suggested as they know best.  They are dealing with these problems 24/7.  I do not regret it for one minute. Like Janet I went for immediate reconstruction. I was tender for a while, but am gradually getting some feeling back.  Once the swelling had gone down I was able to wear my normal bra (a mere 36 B) and feel quite fine.  No one would know I'd had the op. I start the inflation this Thursday, and although I'm not too sure of the proceedure I KNOW I'm in good hands. You have MADE THE RIGHT DECISION andin a few weeks you'll wonder why you were so worried.   I was cutting back my conifers yesterday.  less than 5 weeks after the operation. All the best for Monday, and shall look forward to hearing from you soon. You are in my prayers nightly Love Celia X
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Dear Sharon, Thinking of you this week end.   It will soon be over, and you'll wonder what it was you were afraid of.   Take heart there's always some one worse off than you, but you can never see it at the time. I always thought  how bad mine was, until I read some of the facts on this website. I HAD IT EASY compared to a lot of people. All the very best Celia  X
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, I've been following your thread for many days, and everyone was saying exactly what I was thinking.  I am so glad you've chosen the mastectomy.  You wont regret it. The consultants wouldn't advise such an operation if it wasn't necessary. I had my first op. to remove DCIS at the end of June, then another to remove more tissue that had cancer cells in.  They found I had extensive DCIS so to avoid it becoming full blown "invasive" cancer, they removed my breast.  I had immediate reconstruction, with an implant 4 weeks ago.  I am up and running (literally) and am just waiting to hear from the hospital for the reconstruction to continue.  I do Thank God everyday that I listened asnd took the consultants advice. Shall be thinking of you and watching this space Take care. Think positive.  Celia ps the result of the biopsy on my breast was ALL CLEAR!!!!!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, Sorry you're stillhaving panic attacks.  I was just the same before my mastectomy. I too had extensive calcification in my breast, as I said before, and my lymph nodes were clear.  They do do a biopsy on the breast once its removed, and I've needed no chemo or radiotherapy.  I also had immediate reconstruction. They've placed an implant in the breast, at the same time as the mastectomy, and  I've heard today that they start "inflating" it next Thursday. The scar is "no big deal" it will fade, so I've been told, and I'm not going to have a nipplereconstruction or the tattoo around it.  Yes I've shed a few tears but each day it gets better.  I not shed a single tear since my operation. I read alovely verse in a Sunday supplement, (about a week after my diagnosis:-  Yesterday is history,  Tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift, that'swhy it's called "the present"   Think about that one. Take care thinking of you. Celia
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in June last year. My GP thoughT my lump was a cyst. It turned out to be DCIS. After my first op to remove the lump, they found that it had spread. I had to have another op, together with lymph nodes being removed. They were clear. They then discovered that my breast was FULL of pre cancerous cells so off came the breast.  That was 12 months ago. My husband had been out of work for 12 months, and I was doing general house cleaning for 3 people in our village. I had only 2 weeks off work after each op. You must listen to your body, do your excerises, and when you feel that you've "nearly" had enough S T O P.   I also had implants inserted at the time of my mastectomy, with regular inflation every 6 weeks.  I was able to go on walks with my husband, due to him being out of work, which also helps. Again only as far as I felt able. My husband got a job on the 11th October, and my results were for the 14th, my sister came with me, and I was given the ALL CLEAR. I had no radio and no chemo.   Remember listen to your body, it does tell you when to stop. All the very best  Celia
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Rhapsody, I know exactly how you feel.  I too had the same problem, could feel myself nodding off, so went to bed, only to be wide awake as soon as my head hit the pillow. that was usually any time after 7 pm. A friend suggested I try Quiet Night from Superdrug, and it is very good. It's herbal, so non addictive. I must admit, though that I take 2 tabs just after tea at 5 pm, then another 1 just before I go to bed.   I don't have any tea or coffee after 5 pm, or anything too sweet ie, chocolate, or biscuits unless I'm desperate!!!!! I hope this may help and good luck, and hope you soon have a good nights sleep Celia
Posts.Title: sleep

Posts.Content: Hi Alison, I had my port removed in April this year, together with a lymph node. The port removal wasn't too bad at all.  A bit tender for a few days.  I didn't drive for 3 or 4 days, as I was afraid in case I needed to do an emergency stop, and it "pulling" at the wound.  I was bruised for about a weeks, but I only had 1 night that I found it difficult to sleep, as the port wason the side I tend to sleep on.  But after that it was a relief to have it out of the way. I was also given the ALL CLEAR 2 weeks later. Hope this has helped  and Good Luck Celia
Posts.Title: Port Removal
